|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 04/2023 |estprice = 100 |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0BYRY17YB |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "NanoPi R6C" and "2302" are on top and bottom of board.
{{See also|List of Single-board computers}}
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: [[Rockchip]] RK3588S @2.4GHz Quad-core ARM (Cortex-A76) :+ @1.8GHz Quad-Core ARM (Cortex-A55) *GPU: Mali-G610 MP4 (OpenGL ES3.2, OpenCL 2.2); NPU Support 6T :VPU (with 8K@60fps VP9 and 8K@30fps H265/H264 decoding) *Storage: 0/32GB (eMMC) Flash, TF card (128GB)/MMC card slot *Memory: 4GB/8GB (LPDDR4X) SDRAM *Network: 1x 2.5Gbps, 1x 1Gbps Ethernet ports *USB: 1x USB 3.0, 1x USB 2.0 ports *PCIe: M.2 (Key M), PCIe 2.1 x1 (NVMe) *Power Source: USB (Type-C) support PD, 5V/9V/12V/20V
==Links of Interest== *[https://wiki.friendlyelec.com/wiki/index.php/NanoPi_R6C ''NanoPi R6C'' on '''FriendlyARM''' Wiki] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2023/04/02/nanopi-r6c-review-ubuntu-22-04-nvme-ssd-usb-debug/ ''NanoPi R6C review'' on '''CNX-Software'''] *[https://linuxgizmos.com/nanopi-r6c-taps-rockchip-rk3588s-soc/ ''NanoPi R6C taps Rockchip RK3588S SoC'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
